Title: Additions to the genus Arthrinium in Apiosporaceae
Keywords:
4 new taxa, asexual-sexual morphs, multi-genes, Phylogeny,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
Arthrinium has a widespread distribution occurring in
various habitats (e.g.Â air, soil debris, plants, lichens, marine algae
and even human tissues). It is characterized by the basauxic
conidiogenesis in the asexual morph, with apiospores in the sexual
morph. In this study, seventeen isolates of Arthrinium were collected in
China. Based on their morphology and phylogenetic characterization, four
new species (A. circulare, A. cyclobalanopsidis, A. septatum and A.
zunyiense) are described and seven known species (A. arundinis, A.
garethjonesii, A. guizhouense, A. hydei, A. neosubglobsa, A.
phyllostachium and A. psedoparenchymaticum) are identified, of which the
sexual morph of three species (A. guizhouense, A. phyllostachium and A.
psedoparenchymaticum) and asexual morph of A. garethjonesii are given
for the first time. The detailed descriptions, illustrations and
comparisons with related taxa of these newly collections are provided.
Phylogenetic analyses of combined ITS, LSU, TUB2 and TEF sequence data
support their placements in the genus Arthrinium and justify the new
species establishments and identifications of known species.
